medical_history.chief_complaint: Dyspnea with minimal exertion and lower extremity edema for six months
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began six months before presentation; initially treated with diuretics at an outside hospital. Condition worsened leading to decompensated heart failure and biventricular systolic dysfunction. Symptoms improved with medical therapy including diuretics, beta-blockers, and ACE inhibitors.
